steps.label: Supplier

steps.description: Add items in the table
steps.label: Items
steps.title: List of Items

steps.description: Select an item
steps.label: Item

steps.description: Enter the quantity
steps.label: Accepted Qty
steps.title: Enter Quantity

steps.description: Enter rate of the item
steps.label: Rate

steps.description: You can add taxes here
steps.label: Purchase Taxes and Charges
steps.title: Select taxes

steps.description: The percentage by which you can overbill transactions. For example, if the order value is $100 for an Item and percentage here is set as 10% then you are allowed to bill for $110.
steps.label: Over Billing Allowance (%)
steps.title: Over Billing Allowance Percentage

steps.description: Select the role that is allowed to overbill a transactions.
steps.label: Role Allowed to Over Bill
steps.title: Role Allowed to Over Bill

steps.description: If checked, system will unlink the payment against the respective invoice.
steps.label: Unlink Payment on Cancellation of Invoice
steps.title: Unlink Payment on Cancellation of Invoice

steps.description: Similar to the previous option, this unlinks any advance payments made against Purchase/Sales Orders.
steps.label: Unlink Advance Payment on Cancellation of Order
steps.title: Unlink Advance Payment on Cancellation of Order

steps.description: Tax category can be set on Addresses. An address can be Shipping or Billing address. Set which addres to select when applying Tax Category.
steps.label: Determine Address Tax Category From
steps.title: Determine Address Tax Category From

steps.description: Freeze accounting transactions up to specified date, nobody can make/modify entry except the specified Role.
steps.label: Accounts Frozen Till Date
steps.title: Accounts Frozen Upto

steps.description: Users with this Role are allowed to set frozen accounts and create/modify accounting entries against frozen accounts.
steps.label: Role Allowed to Set Frozen Accounts and Edit Frozen Entries
steps.title: Role Allowed to Set Frozen Accounts & Edit Frozen Entries

steps.description: Select the role that is allowed to submit transactions that exceed credit limits set. The credit limit can be set in the Customer form.
steps.label: Credit Controller
steps.title: Credit Controller

steps.description: By default, the Customer Name is set as per the Full Name entered. If you want Customers to be named by a Naming Series. Choose the 'Naming Series' option.
steps.label: Customer Naming By
steps.title: Customer Naming By

steps.description: If this option is configured 'Yes', ERPNext will prevent you from creating a Sales Invoice or Delivery Note without creating a Sales Order first. This configuration can be overridden for a particular Customer by enabling the 'Allow Sales Invoice Creation Without Sales Order' checkbox in the Customer master.
steps.label: Is Sales Order Required for Sales Invoice & Delivery Note Creation?
steps.title: Sales Order Required for Sales Invoice & Delivery Note Creation

steps.description: If this option is configured 'Yes', ERPNext will prevent you from creating a Sales Invoice without creating a Delivery Note first. This configuration can be overridden for a particular Customer by enabling the 'Allow Sales Invoice Creation Without Delivery Note' checkbox in the Customer master.
steps.label: Is Delivery Note Required for Sales Invoice Creation?
steps.title: Delivery Note Required for Sales Invoice Creation

steps.description: Configure the default Price List when creating a new Sales transaction. Item prices will be fetched from this Price List.
steps.label: Default Price List
steps.title: Default Selling Price List

steps.label: Customer
steps.title: Select Customer

steps.description: When a Supplier is saved, system generates a unique identity or name for that Supplier which can be used to refer the Supplier in various Buying transactions.

steps.description: Configure what should be the default value of Supplier Group when creating a new Supplier.

steps.description: Item prices will be fetched from this Price List.

steps.description: If this option is configured "Yes", ERPNext will prevent you from creating a Purchase Invoice or a Purchase Receipt directly without creating a Purchase Order first.
steps.label: Is Purchase Order Required for Purchase Invoice & Receipt Creation?
steps.title: Purchase Order Required

steps.description: If this option is configured "Yes", ERPNext will prevent you from creating a Purchase Invoice without creating a Purchase Receipt first.
steps.label: Is Purchase Receipt Required for Purchase Invoice Creation?
steps.title: Purchase Receipt Required

steps.description: The purpose of the material request can be selected here. For now select "Purchase" as the purpose.

steps.label: Title

steps.description: Set this template as the default for all sales transactions

steps.description: You can add a row for a tax rule here. These rules can be applied on the net total, or can be a flat amount.
steps.label: Sales Taxes and Charges

steps.description: Name Asset category. You can create categories based on Asset Types like Furniture, Property, Electronics etc.

steps.description: A Field (or a docfield) defines a property of a DocType. You can define the column name, label, datatype and more for DocFields. For instance, a ToDo doctype has fields description, status and priority. These ultimately become columns in the database table tabToDo.
steps.label: Fields
steps.title: Fields

steps.description: This setting is recommended if you wish to track the real-time stock balance in your books of account. This will allow the creation of a General Ledger entry for every stock transaction.
